result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Allen Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. Consecutive to any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Green Lake Co Case 13CF52. **Per the Inmate Request Form filed April 13, 2016 - The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the transfer comports with the rules of the two counties involved.**
**On November 3, 2016 the Court amended the report date for service of jail time on this matter**
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Green Lake Co Case 13CF52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:19 am case called. Defendant Richard Allen Bradley in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over discussion between court and parties prior to going on the record. Attorney Anderson states the defendant was released from Green Lake County on 15CF137 as a concurrent sentence, even though the sentence was clearly set as consecutive. Court makes statement regarding 34 days of jail to be served and the defendant's willingness to serve the sentence as ordered in 15CF137. Court makes further statement regarding service of sentence. Court will grant the defendant consideration for the service of the conditional jail sentence and amends conditions of probation only-90 days WCJ commencing no later than January 2, 2017 with Huber, No Good Time and credit for 56 days served. All other conditions of probation to remain. Dates previously set on 16CF190 remain.

11:07 am cases called-15CF137 & 16CF190. Defendant Richard Allen Bradley in court.  Ruth Zouski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over amount outstanding. Statement by Attorney Zouski regarding payment plan being set with the Clerk's office. Court directs defendant to fill out the paperwork and return it to the clerk's office along with payments as agreed.
Voluntary appearance/Initial appearance on November 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
from ADA Anderson, Dated 10/7/2016
from Defendant Re: Request for Voluntary Appearance on Warrants
from Defendant Re: Request to Quash Warrants

Inmate request form requesting a huber transfer - The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the transfer comports with the rules of the two counties involved.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:38 p.m. Defendant Richard Allen Bradley in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Richard Allen Bradley in custody. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Second or Subsequent enhancer dismissed outright. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 90 days WC Jail - Consecutive to any existing sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Green Lake Co Case 13CF52 - Huber, No GT, 56 day CFTS, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $495 drug buy money w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal rights given.
